issue.title: Set port from the GUI settings
issue.body: Hi, UPNP doesn't work for me, so I managed to get an port-forwarding by my admins. Currently it means to fire up btc core via --port to apply this custom settings. It would be nice, to set (and forget) it via the GUI.

events.body: If you are starting bitcoin-qt with a shortcut, you can add the `--port` argument to the shortcut and you needn't think about it anymore.
I think an option to set the port over the UI (like the SOCKS/TOR proxys) would be nice.

> If you are starting bitcoin-qt with a shortcut, you can add the --port argument to the shortcut and you needn't think about it anymore.

Or just set it in `bitcoin.conf` in the data directory. That's what it is for.

But yes this would be a feature for the 'would be nice' list.
Maybe expose `bitcoin.conf` just like `debug.log` in the GUI? Not sure if mapping every arg to the GUI makes sense.
Exposing bitcoin.conf doesn't make sense. If people want to change core vars, they should be able to find their bitcoin.conf by themselves.
@matthias-g @jonasschnelli Can this be closed since you can currently set the `SOCKS/TOR` proxy in the GUI under `Settings`->`Options`->`Network`
